title: hESC-beta and diabetes human insulin in mice 5

content.question: Based on the data, which of the following best explains how the mice with the implanted hESC-β cells use negative feedback to return blood glucose levels to normal if blood glucose levels increase?

choices.label: Decreased insulin secretion by body cells → increased glucose uptake by mouse β-cells → increased insulin secretion by body cells
Increased insulin production by mouse β-cells → increased glucose uptake by hESC-β cells → decreased glucose metabolism by body cells
Increased insulin secretion by hESC-β cells → increased glucose uptake by body cells → decreased insulin secretion by hESC-β cells
Increased metabolism of glucose by hESC-β cells → differentiation of hESC-β cell into body cells → increased glucose production by body cells

content.answer: Increased insulin secretion by hESC-β cells → increased glucose uptake by body cells → decreased insulin secretion by hESC-β cells
